query: BaroVue atmospheric pressure sensor specifications valid pressure measurement range error codes invalid readings

search_result: The BaroVue 10 atmospheric pressure sensor requires regular maintenance, including desiccant replacement and sensor card recalibration. Its valid pressure measurement range is not explicitly stated in the provided context. Error codes and invalid readings may occur, indicated by pressure and temperature values returned as NAN; this could be due to improper insertion of the sensor card, incorrect wiring, or mismatched SDI-12 addresses. The device also assesses measurement quality, and a poor quality metric suggests the need for factory calibration.

attributes.text:
PTB110 Maintenance
PTB110 does not require regular maintenance.
The sensor has no replaceable parts. If the sensor malfunctions, replace it.

ADJUSTMENT AND CALIBRATION
Calibration of the PTB110 series barometers is NIST traceable
and the barometers are supplied with a NIST traceable
calibration certificate.
There are two push buttons available for the offset fine
adjustment inside the barometer (see the figure on the previous
page). The adjustment step is 0.05 hPa.
OPERATING THE BUTTONS
Restoring Adjustments
To restore the adjustments, press and hold down the left button
while switching on the barometer. After releasing the button, a
green LED starts flashing.
When the factory adjustments are in use, the green LED flashes
twice. When the user adjustments are in use, the green LED
flashes three times.
Now you can change the factory adjustments to user adjustments
or vice versa by pressing the left button.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Using Analog Output Test Mode
To activate the test mode, press and hold down the right button
while switching on the barometer.
The function forces the voltage or frequency output to 50% of
the scale. As an indication of the test mode, the red LED is lit.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Offset Correction
To activate the offset correction mode, press and hold down both
buttons switching on the barometer.
The green and red LEDs are lit. Now you can adjust the offset
correction upwards or downwards.
 Each time when pressing the left button, the offset
goes down by one step (5 Pa), and the green LED
flashes once.
 Each time when pressing the right button, the offset
goes up by one step (5 Pa), and the red LED flashes
once.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.


BaroVue Maintenance

Troubleshooting
Symptom: Pressure and temperature values are returned as NAN.
l Check that the sensor card is inserted fully in its socket and in the correct orientation (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Verify that the white wire is connected to the terminal specified by the
SDI12Recorder() instruction.
l Verify that the red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and that the black wire is connected
to the G terminal.
l Use a digital voltage meter to check the voltage to the sensor. If a switched 12V terminal is
used, temporarily connect the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal for test purposes.
l Verify that the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the address entered for the
SDI12Recorder() instruction. The default address is 0. The address can be verified or
changed with the commands described in SDI-12 command basics (p. 32) or by using the
Device Configuration Utility (p. 21).

Maintenance
Required maintenance includes regularly changing the desiccant and recalibrating the sensor
card. When the Enclosure Accessory Humidity Indicator Card changes from blue to pink, replace
the desiccant in the enclosure and, if applicable, the desiccant chamber.
The BaroVUE 10 calculates information about the quality of the measurement (see Quality metric
[p. 19]). The quality metric gives information about the reliability of the data; a poor quality metric
may mean the data is unreliable, and the device should be sent to the factory for calibration.
However, it is recommended that the sensor card be sent to Campbell Scientific for calibration


Sensor card replacement procedure
CAUTION:
The BaroVUE 10 is sensitive to static when the main case is opened. To avoid damage, take
adequate anti-static measures when handling.
1. 2. Contact Campbell Scientific for your replacement sensor card. When received, take this
newly calibrated card with you to the site of the BaroVUE 10 installation.
Open the main case by unclipping the latch and opening the main door. See Figure 8-1 (p.
21).
l Sensor card plugs into the silver card socket mounted on the motherboard (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Correct sensor-card orientation is with card notch facing down (towards the
motherboard). The card revision number should be visible.
CAUTION:
the slot.
If the sensor card is oriented incorrectly, it will not insert fully. Do not force the card into
To remove the sensor card, push the card down towards the socket then release. Spring
tension pushes the sensor card out of the socket.
NOTE:
The sensor card can be safely removed while the BaroVUE 10 is connected to power.
Store the old sensor card in an electrostatic protective package and return it to Campbell
Scientific for recalibration or general servicing.
Unpack the replacement sensor card, avoiding static discharges to the element by touching
the package before touching the element.
Carefully align and insert the sensor card in the card socket on the motherboard.
Confirm the correct orientation and gently push the sensor card into the socket until it
clicks into place.
Before closing the main case, double-check that the card is inserted in the correct
orientation. Refer to Figure 8-1 (p. 21).
Close the main case and secure it by pressing down on the latch and clipping it into
position

search_result: The Vaisala Barocap Digital Barometer PTB210 has a valid pressure measurement range of 500 to 1100 hPa and 50 to 1100 hPa, with various analog output scalings. Error codes or invalid readings could arise from issues such as non-linearity (±0.10 to ±0.20 hPa), hysteresis (±0.05 to ±0.10 hPa), repeatability (±0.05 to ±0.10 hPa), and calibration uncertainty (±0.07 to ±0.20 hPa) based on different classes of accuracy. It's designed for harsh environments with IP65 protection and operational reliability to measure barometric pressure.

attributes.text:
Page 1:
BAROCAPâ Digital Barometer
PTB210
Features
• 500 … 1100 hPa or 50 … 1100 hPa
pressure ranges with serial output
• Different scalings between
500 … 1100 hPa with
analog output
• Electronics housing IP65
protected against sprayed water
• Accurate and stable measurement
• Traceable calibration
(certificate included)
Vaisala BAROCAPâ Digital Barometer PTB210 is a reliable outdoor barometer for
harsh conditions.
For Harsh Environments
PTB210 is ideal for outdoor installations
and harsh environments. PTB210 is
designed to operate in a wide
temperature range, and the electronics
housing provides IP65 (NEMA 4)
standardized protection against sprayed
water.
PTB210 is ideal for use in applications
such as weather stations, data buoys and
ships, airports, and agrology. They are
also an excellent solution for monitoring
barometric pressure in industrial
equipment such as laser interferometers
and engine test benches.
Several Pressure Ranges
PTB210 is designed for various pressure
ranges. They are available in two basic
configurations:
• Serial output for 500 … 1100 hPa
• Serial output for 50 … 1100 hPa
• Analog output with different scalings
between 500 … 1100 hPa
Accurate and Stable
Measurement
PTB210 is digitally adjusted and
calibrated by using electronic working
standards. A higher accuracy barometer,
that is fine-tuned and calibrated against
a high-precision pressure calibrator, is
available for the 500 … 1100 hPa pressure
range.
In addition, PTB210 integrates directly
with Vaisala Static Pressure Head Series
SPH10/20. This pairing offers accurate
measurement in all wind conditions.
Vaisala BAROCAP Technology
PTB210 uses the Vaisala BAROCAP
sensor, a silicon capacitive absolute
pressure sensor developed by Vaisala for
barometric pressure applications.
The Vaisala BAROCAP sensor provides
excellent hysteresis and repeatability
characteristics and outstanding
temperature and long-term stability.
PTB210 is delivered with a traceable
factory calibration certificate.
PTB210 paired with SPH10 static pressure head

search_result:
To troubleshoot the BaroVue pressure sensor returning a -9999.0 reading:
1. **Check Connections**: Ensure the sensor card is fully inserted and correctly oriented. Verify connections of the white, red, and black wires.
2. **Voltage Check**: Use a digital voltmeter to check the supply voltage, connecting the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal if necessary.
3. **SDI-12 Address**: Confirm that the BaroVUE 10's SDI-12 address matches the configuration used.
4. **Replace Sensor Card**: If readings remain erroneous, consider replacing the sensor card, following anti-static precautions during the process.  
5. **Calibration**: If data quality is poor, recalibration may be needed; ideally, send the sensor card to Campbell Scientific for calibration.

search_result:
To troubleshoot a BaroVue pressure sensor displaying a -9999.0 reading, follow these steps:
1. **Calibration Check**: Ensure the sensor is calibrated correctly, as it significantly affects accuracy.
2. **Firmware Update**: Check if the sensor's firmware is up-to-date; an update may resolve bugs causing incorrect readings.
3. **Pressure Range**: Verify if the sensor is operating within its specified pressure range; exceeding this may cause erroneous readings.
4. **Physical Inspection**: Inspect the sensor for any signs of damage or environmental factors affecting its operation.
5. **Replacement**: If troubleshooting fails, consider replacing the sensor.

attributes.text:
PTB110 Maintenance
PTB110 does not require regular maintenance.
The sensor has no replaceable parts. If the sensor malfunctions, replace it.

ADJUSTMENT AND CALIBRATION
Calibration of the PTB110 series barometers is NIST traceable
and the barometers are supplied with a NIST traceable
calibration certificate.
There are two push buttons available for the offset fine
adjustment inside the barometer (see the figure on the previous
page). The adjustment step is 0.05 hPa.
OPERATING THE BUTTONS
Restoring Adjustments
To restore the adjustments, press and hold down the left button
while switching on the barometer. After releasing the button, a
green LED starts flashing.
When the factory adjustments are in use, the green LED flashes
twice. When the user adjustments are in use, the green LED
flashes three times.
Now you can change the factory adjustments to user adjustments
or vice versa by pressing the left button.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Using Analog Output Test Mode
To activate the test mode, press and hold down the right button
while switching on the barometer.
The function forces the voltage or frequency output to 50% of
the scale. As an indication of the test mode, the red LED is lit.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Offset Correction
To activate the offset correction mode, press and hold down both
buttons switching on the barometer.
The green and red LEDs are lit. Now you can adjust the offset
correction upwards or downwards.
 Each time when pressing the left button, the offset
goes down by one step (5 Pa), and the green LED
flashes once.
 Each time when pressing the right button, the offset
goes up by one step (5 Pa), and the red LED flashes
once.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.


BaroVue Maintenance

Troubleshooting
Symptom: Pressure and temperature values are returned as NAN.
l Check that the sensor card is inserted fully in its socket and in the correct orientation (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Verify that the white wire is connected to the terminal specified by the
SDI12Recorder() instruction.
l Verify that the red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and that the black wire is connected
to the G terminal.
l Use a digital voltage meter to check the voltage to the sensor. If a switched 12V terminal is
used, temporarily connect the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal for test purposes.
l Verify that the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the address entered for the
SDI12Recorder() instruction. The default address is 0. The address can be verified or
changed with the commands described in SDI-12 command basics (p. 32) or by using the
Device Configuration Utility (p. 21).

Maintenance
Required maintenance includes regularly changing the desiccant and recalibrating the sensor
card. When the Enclosure Accessory Humidity Indicator Card changes from blue to pink, replace
the desiccant in the enclosure and, if applicable, the desiccant chamber.
The BaroVUE 10 calculates information about the quality of the measurement (see Quality metric
[p. 19]). The quality metric gives information about the reliability of the data; a poor quality metric
may mean the data is unreliable, and the device should be sent to the factory for calibration.
However, it is recommended that the sensor card be sent to Campbell Scientific for calibration


Sensor card replacement procedure
CAUTION:
The BaroVUE 10 is sensitive to static when the main case is opened. To avoid damage, take
adequate anti-static measures when handling.
1. 2. Contact Campbell Scientific for your replacement sensor card. When received, take this
newly calibrated card with you to the site of the BaroVUE 10 installation.
Open the main case by unclipping the latch and opening the main door. See Figure 8-1 (p.
21).
l Sensor card plugs into the silver card socket mounted on the motherboard (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Correct sensor-card orientation is with card notch facing down (towards the
motherboard). The card revision number should be visible.
CAUTION:
the slot.
If the sensor card is oriented incorrectly, it will not insert fully. Do not force the card into
To remove the sensor card, push the card down towards the socket then release. Spring
tension pushes the sensor card out of the socket.
NOTE:
The sensor card can be safely removed while the BaroVUE 10 is connected to power.
Store the old sensor card in an electrostatic protective package and return it to Campbell
Scientific for recalibration or general servicing.
Unpack the replacement sensor card, avoiding static discharges to the element by touching
the package before touching the element.
Carefully align and insert the sensor card in the card socket on the motherboard.
Confirm the correct orientation and gently push the sensor card into the socket until it
clicks into place.
Before closing the main case, double-check that the card is inserted in the correct
orientation. Refer to Figure 8-1 (p. 21).
Close the main case and secure it by pressing down on the latch and clipping it into
position

### Troubleshooting Guides for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor:
1. **NAN Values for Pressure and Temperature:**
   - Ensure sensor card is fully inserted and oriented correctly.
   - Verify connections:
     - White wire to specified terminal for SDI12Recorder().
     - Red wire to a 12V terminal; black wire to G terminal.
   - Check voltage to the sensor with a digital meter.
   - Make sure BaroVUE's SDI-12 address matches the entered address in SDI12Recorder(). 

### Maintenance Procedures for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor:
1. **Regular Maintenance:**
   - Change desiccant when the humidity indicator card turns from blue to pink.
   - Recalibrate the sensor card regularly. 
   - If quality metric indicates poor data reliability, consider sending the device to the factory for calibration.

2. **Sensor Card Replacement Procedure:**
   - Take anti-static measures when handling the sensor card.
   - Contact Campbell Scientific for a replacement card.
   - Open the main case, ensuring correct orientation of the new sensor card (notch facing down).
   - Insert the sensor card carefully and confirm orientation before closing the case.

search_result:
### Troubleshooting Guides for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor
1. **Check Operating Conditions**: Ensure the sensor is operated under appropriate humidity and temperature conditions. The PTB210 operates in non-condensing humidity environments and in temperatures ranging from -40 to +60 °C.

2. **Calibration Issues**: Verify if the sensor requires recalibration. The PTB210 is delivered with a traceable calibration certificate, and inaccuracies can arise if recalibration is overdue.

3. **Connections and Wiring**: Inspect serial and analog connections for proper installation and secure fittings to avoid signal loss or erroneous readings.

4. **Power Supply Verification**: Ensure that the supply voltage is within the specified range (5–28 VDC for RS-232/TTL and 8–18 VDC for RS-485 or analog output).

5. **Signal Output Issues**: If there are unexpected readings, compare the pressure output and check for proper scaling set in the configuration.

6. **Mechanical Inspection**: Check for any physical damage to the housing or sensor. The PTB210 has an IP65 rating, ensure this protection is intact to avoid water damage.

### Maintenance Procedures for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor
1. **Regular Calibration**: Regularly calibrate the sensor according to manufacturer recommendations post-deployment.

2. **Visual Inspections**: Conduct periodic visual checks for any signs of wear, damage, or contamination that may affect performance.

3. **Environmental Monitoring**: Monitor the environmental conditions where the sensor is installed to ensure adherence to its operational specs.

4. **Firmware Updates**: Keep track of any firmware or software updates from the manufacturer to enhance performance and fix bugs.

5. **Documentation**: Maintain a log of calibration and maintenance activities to keep track of performance and operational history.

attributes.text:
Page 1:
BAROCAPâ Digital Barometer
PTB210
Features
• 500 … 1100 hPa or 50 … 1100 hPa
pressure ranges with serial output
• Different scalings between
500 … 1100 hPa with
analog output
• Electronics housing IP65
protected against sprayed water
• Accurate and stable measurement
• Traceable calibration
(certificate included)
Vaisala BAROCAPâ Digital Barometer PTB210 is a reliable outdoor barometer for
harsh conditions.
For Harsh Environments
PTB210 is ideal for outdoor installations
and harsh environments. PTB210 is
designed to operate in a wide
temperature range, and the electronics
housing provides IP65 (NEMA 4)
standardized protection against sprayed
water.
PTB210 is ideal for use in applications
such as weather stations, data buoys and
ships, airports, and agrology. They are
also an excellent solution for monitoring
barometric pressure in industrial
equipment such as laser interferometers
and engine test benches.
Several Pressure Ranges

formatted_results:
### Troubleshooting Guides for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor:
1. **NAN Values for Pressure and Temperature:**
   - Ensure sensor card is fully inserted and oriented correctly.
   - Verify connections:
     - White wire to specified terminal for SDI12Recorder().
     - Red wire to a 12V terminal; black wire to G terminal.
   - Check voltage to the sensor with a digital meter.
   - Make sure BaroVUE's SDI-12 address matches the entered address in SDI12Recorder(). 

### Maintenance Procedures for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor:
1. **Regular Maintenance:**
   - Change desiccant when the humidity indicator card turns from blue to pink.
   - Recalibrate the sensor card regularly. 
   - If quality metric indicates poor data reliability, consider sending the device to the factory for calibration.

2. **Sensor Card Replacement Procedure:**
   - Take anti-static measures when handling the sensor card.
   - Contact Campbell Scientific for a replacement card.
   - Open the main case, ensuring correct orientation of the new sensor card (notch facing down).
   - Insert the sensor card carefully and confirm orientation before closing the case.

### Troubleshooting Guides for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor
1. **Check Operating Conditions**: Ensure the sensor is operated under appropriate humidity and temperature conditions. The PTB210 operates in non-condensing humidity environments and in temperatures ranging from -40 to +60 °C.

2. **Calibration Issues**: Verify if the sensor requires recalibration. The PTB210 is delivered with a traceable calibration certificate, and inaccuracies can arise if recalibration is overdue.

3. **Connections and Wiring**: Inspect serial and analog connections for proper installation and secure fittings to avoid signal loss or erroneous readings.

4. **Power Supply Verification**: Ensure that the supply voltage is within the specified range (5–28 VDC for RS-232/TTL and 8–18 VDC for RS-485 or analog output).

5. **Signal Output Issues**: If there are unexpected readings, compare the pressure output and check for proper scaling set in the configuration.

6. **Mechanical Inspection**: Check for any physical damage to the housing or sensor. The PTB210 has an IP65 rating, ensure this protection is intact to avoid water damage.

### Maintenance Procedures for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor
1. **Regular Calibration**: Regularly calibrate the sensor according to manufacturer recommendations post-deployment.

2. **Visual Inspections**: Conduct periodic visual checks for any signs of wear, damage, or contamination that may affect performance.

3. **Environmental Monitoring**: Monitor the environmental conditions where the sensor is installed to ensure adherence to its operational specs.

4. **Firmware Updates**: Keep track of any firmware or software updates from the manufacturer to enhance performance and fix bugs.

5. **Documentation**: Maintain a log of calibration and maintenance activities to keep track of performance and operational history.

attributes.text:
PTB110 Maintenance
PTB110 does not require regular maintenance.
The sensor has no replaceable parts. If the sensor malfunctions, replace it.

ADJUSTMENT AND CALIBRATION
Calibration of the PTB110 series barometers is NIST traceable
and the barometers are supplied with a NIST traceable
calibration certificate.
There are two push buttons available for the offset fine
adjustment inside the barometer (see the figure on the previous
page). The adjustment step is 0.05 hPa.
OPERATING THE BUTTONS
Restoring Adjustments
To restore the adjustments, press and hold down the left button
while switching on the barometer. After releasing the button, a
green LED starts flashing.
When the factory adjustments are in use, the green LED flashes
twice. When the user adjustments are in use, the green LED
flashes three times.
Now you can change the factory adjustments to user adjustments
or vice versa by pressing the left button.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Using Analog Output Test Mode
To activate the test mode, press and hold down the right button
while switching on the barometer.
The function forces the voltage or frequency output to 50% of
the scale. As an indication of the test mode, the red LED is lit.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Offset Correction
To activate the offset correction mode, press and hold down both
buttons switching on the barometer.
The green and red LEDs are lit. Now you can adjust the offset
correction upwards or downwards.
 Each time when pressing the left button, the offset
goes down by one step (5 Pa), and the green LED
flashes once.
 Each time when pressing the right button, the offset
goes up by one step (5 Pa), and the red LED flashes
once.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.


BaroVue Maintenance

Troubleshooting
Symptom: Pressure and temperature values are returned as NAN.
l Check that the sensor card is inserted fully in its socket and in the correct orientation (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Verify that the white wire is connected to the terminal specified by the
SDI12Recorder() instruction.
l Verify that the red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and that the black wire is connected
to the G terminal.
l Use a digital voltage meter to check the voltage to the sensor. If a switched 12V terminal is
used, temporarily connect the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal for test purposes.
l Verify that the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the address entered for the
SDI12Recorder() instruction. The default address is 0. The address can be verified or
changed with the commands described in SDI-12 command basics (p. 32) or by using the
Device Configuration Utility (p. 21).

Maintenance
Required maintenance includes regularly changing the desiccant and recalibrating the sensor
card. When the Enclosure Accessory Humidity Indicator Card changes from blue to pink, replace
the desiccant in the enclosure and, if applicable, the desiccant chamber.
The BaroVUE 10 calculates information about the quality of the measurement (see Quality metric
[p. 19]). The quality metric gives information about the reliability of the data; a poor quality metric
may mean the data is unreliable, and the device should be sent to the factory for calibration.
However, it is recommended that the sensor card be sent to Campbell Scientific for calibration


Sensor card replacement procedure
CAUTION:
The BaroVUE 10 is sensitive to static when the main case is opened. To avoid damage, take
adequate anti-static measures when handling.
1. 2. Contact Campbell Scientific for your replacement sensor card. When received, take this
newly calibrated card with you to the site of the BaroVUE 10 installation.

21).

To remove the sensor card, push the card down towards the socket then release. Spring

NOTE:
The sensor card can be safely removed while the BaroVUE 10 is connected to power.
Store the old sensor card in an electrostatic protective package and return it to Campbell

Unpack the replacement sensor card, avoiding static discharges to the element by touching

### Troubleshooting Guides for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor:
1. **Check Operating Conditions**: Ensure the sensor is used within specified operating humidity (non-condensing) and temperature (-40 … +60 °C).
2. **Calibration and Accuracy**: Verify the calibration certificate. If measurements are inaccurate, recalibrate using a high-precision pressure calibrator.
3. **Electrical Connections**: Inspect serial and power connections. Ensure power supply (5 … 28 VDC for RS-232/TTL, 8 … 18 VDC for RS-485/analog) is stable and within specification.
4. **Inspect for Damage**: Check housing for any damages that may affect IP65 (NEMA 4) rating, as moisture ingress can lead to faulty readings.
5. **Review Response Time and Settling**: Make sure the settling time at startup is adequate (2 seconds).

### Maintenance Procedures:
1. **Regular Calibration**: Schedule regular calibrations using traceable standards to maintain accuracy.
2. **Clean the Sensor**: Periodically clean the sensor housing and ensure the pressure fitting is free from obstructions.
3. **Inspect Operating Environment**: Ensure the sensor remains in environments not exceeding max pressure limit (5,000 hPa) to prevent damage.
4. **Monitor Performance**: Regularly check the stability and output of measurements for any unexpected drift or anomalies in readings.

l Verify that the red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and that the black wire is connected
to the G terminal.
l Use a digital voltage meter to check the voltage to the sensor. If a switched 12V terminal is
used, temporarily connect the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal for test purposes.
l Verify that the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the address entered for the
SDI12Recorder() instruction. The default address is 0. The address can be verified or
changed with the commands described in SDI-12 command basics (p. 32) or by using the
Device Configuration Utility (p. 21).

Maintenance
Required maintenance includes regularly changing the desiccant and recalibrating the sensor
card. When the Enclosure Accessory Humidity Indicator Card changes from blue to pink, replace
the desiccant in the enclosure and, if applicable, the desiccant chamber.
The BaroVUE 10 calculates information about the quality of the measurement (see Quality metric
[p. 19]). The quality metric gives information about the reliability of the data; a poor quality metric
may mean the data is unreliable, and the device should be sent to the factory for calibration.
However, it is recommended that the sensor card be sent to Campbell Scientific for calibration


Sensor card replacement procedure
CAUTION:
The BaroVUE 10 is sensitive to static when the main case is opened. To avoid damage, take
adequate anti-static measures when handling.
1. 2. Contact Campbell Scientific for your replacement sensor card. When received, take this
newly calibrated card with you to the site of the BaroVUE 10 installation.
Open the main case by unclipping the latch and opening the main door. See Figure 8-1 (p.
21).
l Sensor card plugs into the silver card socket mounted on the motherboard (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Correct sensor-card orientation is with card notch facing down (towards the
motherboard). The card revision number should be visible.
CAUTION:
the slot.
If the sensor card is oriented incorrectly, it will not insert fully. Do not force the card into
To remove the sensor card, push the card down towards the socket then release. Spring
tension pushes the sensor card out of the socket.
NOTE:
The sensor card can be safely removed while the BaroVUE 10 is connected to power.
Store the old sensor card in an electrostatic protective package and return it to Campbell
Scientific for recalibration or general servicing.
Unpack the replacement sensor card, avoiding static discharges to the element by touching
the package before touching the element.
Carefully align and insert the sensor card in the card socket on the motherboard.
Confirm the correct orientation and gently push the sensor card into the socket until it
clicks into place.
Before closing the main case, double-check that the card is inserted in the correct
orientation. Refer to Figure 8-1 (p. 21).
Close the main case and secure it by pressing down on the latch and clipping it into

Vaisala BAROCAPâ Digital Barometer PTB210 is a reliable outdoor barometer for
harsh conditions.
For Harsh Environments
PTB210 is ideal for outdoor installations
and harsh environments. PTB210 is
designed to operate in a wide
temperature range, and the electronics
housing provides IP65 (NEMA 4)
standardized protection against sprayed
water.
PTB210 is ideal for use in applications
such as weather stations, data buoys and
ships, airports, and agrology. They are
also an excellent solution for monitoring
barometric pressure in industrial
equipment such as laser interferometers
and engine test benches.
Several Pressure Ranges
PTB210 is designed for various pressure
ranges. They are available in two basic
configurations:
• Serial output for 500 … 1100 hPa
• Serial output for 50 … 1100 hPa
• Analog output with different scalings
between 500 … 1100 hPa
Accurate and Stable
Measurement
PTB210 is digitally adjusted and
calibrated by using electronic working
standards. A higher accuracy barometer,
that is fine-tuned and calibrated against
a high-precision pressure calibrator, is
available for the 500 … 1100 hPa pressure
range.
In addition, PTB210 integrates directly
with Vaisala Static Pressure Head Series
SPH10/20. This pairing offers accurate
measurement in all wind conditions.
Vaisala BAROCAP Technology
PTB210 uses the Vaisala BAROCAP
sensor, a silicon capacitive absolute
pressure sensor developed by Vaisala for
barometric pressure applications.
The Vaisala BAROCAP sensor provides
excellent hysteresis and repeatability
characteristics and outstanding
temperature and long-term stability.
PTB210 is delivered with a traceable
factory calibration certificate.
PTB210 paired with SPH10 static pressure head

### Troubleshooting for BaroVue Atmospheric Pressure Sensor:
1. **Pressure and Temperature Values as NAN:** 
   - Check sensor card orientation and insertion.
   - Verify white wire connection.
   - Ensure red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and black wire to G.
   - Use a digital voltmeter to check voltage to the sensor.
   - Ensure the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the SDI12Recorder() instruction.

### Maintenance Procedures:
- Regularly change the desiccant when humidity indicator changes from blue to pink.
- Recalibrate the sensor card as needed.
- For sensor card replacement:
   1. Ensure anti-static measures are taken while handling.
   2. Obtain replacement card from Campbell Scientific.
   3. Ensure correct orientation (notch facing down) during installation. 
   4. Confirm the card is firmly in place before closing the case.
